Variable Naming System

Source: vignettes/variable_naming_system.Rmd
variable_naming_system.Rmd

Variable Naming Structure

The variable naming system is a standard approach for classifying allometric response variables and covariates. In the allometric modeling literature, a diverse set of names are available for many similar types of variables. For example, one may wish to refer to the volume of the main stem of a tree, the volume of the stump, the diameter of a stump, the diameter at breast height, etc. Analysts may also wish to refer to different spatial scales, such as plot- or stand-level variables.

The basic structure of a variable name is:

[increment_flag_][measure][component][...modifiers][_scale_flag]

The [increment_flag_] and [_scale_flag] portions are optional flags that allow a user to specify if the variable is an increment (e.g., diameter increment), and the scale flag allows a user to specify plot- or stand-level variables. If these flags are not specified, then the variable is assumed to be a non-increment tree-level variable.

[measure] and [component] are both single characters that encode the type of measurement (e.g., diameter, height, etc.) and the portion of the tree the variable is referred to (e.g., stem, foliage, etc.), respectively. These are followed by optional modifiers that allow further specification of the variable.

The get_variable_def function allows the user to search for existing variable definitions. For example, we can examine a common variable name, "dsob"

get_variable_def("dsob")
##   component measure search_str bark_modifier height_modifier
## 5         s       d       dsob             o               b
##                                           description measure_name component_name suffix
## 5 diameter of the stem, outside bark at breast height     diameter           stem      t
##   scale_description
## 5              tree

and find that it is the diameter of the stem, outside bark at breast height. We see that the measure is "d" for diameter, the component is "s" for stem and two modifiers are used (bark and height modifiers) with values of "o" and "b" respectively.

If we want to refer to a diameter outside bark increment, simply add the increment flag "i_":

get_variable_def("i_dsob")
##   component measure search_str bark_modifier height_modifier
## 5         s       d       dsob             o               b
##                                                       description measure_name component_name
## 5 diameter of the stem, outside bark at breast height (increment)     diameter           stem
##   suffix scale_description prefix prefix_description
## 5      t              tree      i          increment

If we want to refer to a plot-level diameter outside bark (e.g., the mean diameter of trees on a plot), add a scale flag "_p" as a suffix.

get_variable_def("dsob_p")
##   component measure search_str bark_modifier height_modifier
## 5         s       d       dsob             o               b
##                                                        description measure_name component_name
## 5 diameter of the stem, outside bark at breast height (plot-level)     diameter           stem
##   suffix scale_description
## 5      p              plot

there is also a scale flag for stand-level variables, "_s".

Measures

All variable names begin with a “measure”. In the example above, we searched the naming system for d measures, but others are available. There are 8 established measures:

measure_defs
##   measure measure_name
## 1       a          age
## 2       b      biomass
## 3       d     diameter
## 4       e      density
## 5       g   basal area
## 6       h       height
## 7       r        ratio
## 8       v       volume

We recognize that the use of “measure” here is somewhat loose (e.g., diameter and height are both measures of length). However, the variable naming system is meant to preserve at least some connection to commonly used terms for variables in allometric modeling.

Components

All variable names then have a second character that specifies the tree component. There are 11 established components:

component_defs
##    component component_name
## 1          b         branch
## 2          c          crown
## 3          f        foliage
## 4          k           bark
## 5          r           root
## 6          s           stem
## 7          t           tree
## 8          u          stump
## 9          w           wood
## 10         h          shrub
## 11         v          cover

Mixing these first two character codes provides an expressive system to refer to measures and components. For example, the biomass of foliage, if one were interested in it, would begin bf, the volume of the stem would be vs, and the diameter of the stump would be du.

Measure-Component Modifiers

Within a given measure-component pair, a number of useful modifiers are available. These are specific to the measure-component pair. For example, an astute modeler may be wondering, “how do I refer to diameter at breast height outside bark”? These modifiers enable this level of specificity.

Diameter of Stem (ds) Modifiers

Some of the most common allometric variables are that of stem diameter, which arises in taper modeling, merchantable heights and, of course, diameter at breast height. ds modifiers enable a user to specify these broad range of variables. The available ds variables are:

get_variable_def("ds")
##   component measure search_str bark_modifier height_modifier
## 5         s       d       dsob             o               b
## 6         s       d       dsoh             o               h
## 7         s       d       dsih             i               h
## 8         s       d       dsib             i               b
## 9         s       d       dsoc             o               c
##                                                description measure_name component_name suffix
## 5      diameter of the stem, outside bark at breast height     diameter           stem      t
## 6 diameter of the stem, outside bark at a specified height     diameter           stem      t
## 7  diameter of the stem, inside bark at a specified height     diameter           stem      t
## 8       diameter of the stem, inside bark at breast height     diameter           stem      t
## 9              diameter outside bark above the root collar     diameter           stem      t
##   scale_description
## 5              tree
## 6              tree
## 7              tree
## 8              tree
## 9              tree

Height of Stem (hs) Modifiers 

get_variable_def("hs")
##    component measure search_str height_modifier modifier
## 3          s       h        hst               t         
## 4          s       h        hsm               m         
## 5          s       h        hso               o         
## 6          s       h        hsb               b         
## 7          s       h        hsv               v         
## 8          s       h        hsd               d         
## 9          s       h    hsdip75               d     ip75
## 10         s       h    hsdop67               d     op67
## 11         s       h     hstixi               t      ixi
## 12         s       h    hstix20               t     ix20
## 13         s       h    hstix50               t     ix50
## 14         s       h   hstix100               t    ix100
## 15         s       h        hsl               l         
##                                                                           description measure_name
## 3                                                            total height of the stem       height
## 4                                                     merchantable height of the stem       height
## 5                                              height of the stem above breast height       height
## 6                                                    height of the stem to crown base       height
## 7                                height of the stem to crown base above breast height       height
## 8                                              height to a specified diameter (taper)       height
## 9   height to a diameter that is 0.75 times the diameter inside bark at breast height       height
## 10 height to a diameter that is 0.67 times the diameter outside bark at breast height       height
## 11                                           site index (base age invariant function)       height
## 12                                                     site index at 20 year base age       height
## 13                                                     site index at 50 year base age       height
## 14                                                    site index at 100 year base age       height
## 15                                 distance from tip of stem to merchantibility limit       height
##    component_name suffix scale_description
## 3            stem      t              tree
## 4            stem      t              tree
## 5            stem      t              tree
## 6            stem      t              tree
## 7            stem      t              tree
## 8            stem      t              tree
## 9            stem      t              tree
## 10           stem      t              tree
## 11           stem      t              tree
## 12           stem      t              tree
## 13           stem      t              tree
## 14           stem      t              tree
## 15           stem      t              tree

Volume of Stem (vs) Modifiers 

get_variable_def("vs")
##   component measure search_str modifier_1 modifier_2
## 2         s       v       vsia          i          a
## 3         s       v       vsoa          o          a
## 4         s       v       vsim          i          m
## 5         s       v       vsom          o          m
## 6         s       v       vsib          i          b
## 7         s       v       vsio          i          o
## 8         s       v       vsoo          o          o
##                                                       description measure_name component_name
## 2  volume of the entire stem inside bark, including top and stump       volume           stem
## 3 volume of the entire stem outside bark, including top and stump       volume           stem
## 4      volume of the merchantable portion of the stem inside bark       volume           stem
## 5      volume of the merchantable portion of the stem inside bark       volume           stem
## 6              volume of the stem below breast height inside bark       volume           stem
## 7              volume of the stem above breast height inside bark       volume           stem
## 8             volume of the stem above breast height outside bark       volume           stem
##   suffix scale_description
## 2      t              tree
## 3      t              tree
## 4      t              tree
## 5      t              tree
## 6      t              tree
## 7      t              tree
## 8      t              tree

Biomass (b) Components and Modifiers 

get_variable_def("b")
##   component measure search_str               description measure_name component_name suffix
## 1         b       b         bb            branch biomass      biomass         branch      t
## 2         f       b         bf           foliage biomass      biomass        foliage      t
## 3         h       b         bh             shrub biomass      biomass          shrub      t
## 4         k       b         bk              bark biomass      biomass           bark      t
## 5         r       b         br              root biomass      biomass           root      t
## 6         s       b         bs              stem biomass      biomass           stem      t
## 7         t       b         bt              tree biomass      biomass           tree      t
## 8         w       b         bw stem biomass without bark      biomass           wood      t
##   scale_description
## 1              tree
## 2              tree
## 3              tree
## 4              tree
## 5              tree
## 6              tree
## 7              tree
## 8              tree
